summary: The Mortgage Debt Tax Forgiveness Act of 2025 aims to permanently exclude discharged qualified principal residence indebtedness from gross income, amending Section 108(a)(1)(E) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The bill, introduced in the House of Representatives by Ms. Brownley, seeks to provide tax relief related to mortgage debt. The amendment will apply to debts discharged after December 31, 2025.
